question: Will the world remain "normal" through April 1, 2025, according to the specified criteria?
description:
As of July 2, 2024, the questions had the following probabilities assessed by the Metaculus Community: 

- [Development of artificial general intelligence](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/5121/date-of-artificial-general-intelligence/) - Cumulative probability of 40% before 2030.

- A [10% reduction in the human population](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/1493/global-population-decline-10-by-2100/) - 36% chance of happening before 2100.

- [Global GDP increases by 30% or more in one year](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/5159/date-of-gwp-growth-over-130/) - 13% cumulative probability before 2030.

- The [discovery of alien technosignatures](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/1629/alien-technosignature-detection-by-2050/) - 3% chance of happening before 2050.

- A [worldview-shattering explanation for UAPs (UFOs)](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/18075/shocking-uap-explanation-by-july-2028/) - 1.4% before July 22, 2028.

- [World War III](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/2534/world-war-three-before-2050/) - 25% chance before 2050.

- A [nuclear weapon is detonated as an act of war](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/4779/at-least-1-nuclear-detonation-in-war-by-2050/) - 23% before 2050.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Experts: In 10 Years' Time, Things on Earth Will Be Worse**
According to the Atlantic Council's Global Foresight report, hundreds of experts surveyed believe that the world will be in a worse state in 2035. The report cites concerns over an increasing number of nuclear weapons, ongoing world conflicts, and the 'chances of democratic depression' worldwide. As Axios reports, only a small minority of the over 350 international experts surveyed think that democracy will improve in the next decade. The experts' outlook is bleak, with many anticipating a decline in global stability and security.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 13, 2025 08:40 PM
Source:[Newser](https://www.newser.com/story/364235/experts-predictions-for-earth-in-2035-arent-great.html)

**Ecumenical Initiative Calls for Unity to Celebrate Easter Together**
The Ecumenical Initiative 'Pasqua Together 2025' is calling for unity among Christians to celebrate Easter together, saying 'it is unacceptable that the division continues.' The initiative, led by Kostas Mygdalis, aims to promote a common date for Easter between Orthodox and Catholic Christians. This year, both Easter dates coincide on April 20 due to the concordance of the Julian and Gregorian calendars. Mygdalis emphasizes that the celebration of Easter in 2025 should not be seen as just a calendar agreement, but as an opportunity to put Christ at the center of Christian faith. He also highlights the need for unity in the world, saying 'the world needs unity. A common date for Easter is a step towards this unity.' However, he warns that the administrative structures of the churches are resistant to addressing this issue, fearing the creation of new extremism and divisions. Mygdalis also notes that the dialogue between Christian churches is advancing slowly, and that the effort to celebrate Easter together should be part of a 'pilgrimage of reconciliation and unity' that will continue beyond 2025.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 13, 2025 02:29 PM
Source:[aciprensa.com](https://www.aciprensa.com/noticias/110819/iniciativa-ecumenica-pide-unidad-para-celebrar-juntos-la-pascua)

**Major warning issued as huge change coming to weekly social welfare payment amid new rules**
A major change is coming to the weekly Fuel Allowance payment in April 2025. The 2024/2025 Fuel Allowance, which provides a weekly payment of €33 for 28 weeks or two lump sum payments, will come to an end on April 4, 2025. To qualify for the Fuel Allowance, individuals must meet certain criteria, including living alone, receiving a qualifying payment, or satisfying a means test. Those over 66 can also qualify, but it is means-tested. The maximum weekly income limit for Fuel Allowance is €489.30, and individuals can have an income from rent of up to €269.23 a week without affecting their Fuel Allowance. Fuel Allowance recipients will also receive a Telephone Support Allowance of €2.50 weekly, paid automatically with their main social welfare payment.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 13, 2025 11:12 AM
Source:[thesun.ie](https://www.thesun.ie/money/14712586/money-dole-social-welfare-payment-fuel-ireland/)

**Asteroid 2024 YRA: Probability of Impact on Earth Increases, but Experts Remain Calm**
The probability of asteroid 2024 YRA impacting Earth in 2032 has increased from 1.2% to 2.3%, according to the Center for Near Earth Object Studies of NASA. However, experts remain calm, as the chance of a flyby is still 97.7%. David Rankin from the Catalina Sky Survey explained, 'We are still at 97.7% chance of a flyby.' He emphasized that such adjustments to calculations are normal, especially for newly discovered asteroids. 'The more data we collect, the more accurate our predictions become.' The asteroid, which is approximately 40-90 meters in size, can still be observed from terrestrial telescopes until April and will be studied by the James-Webb-Weltraumteleskop in March. Additional data will provide a clearer picture, and the impact probability is likely to decrease or the asteroid may be removed from the risk list altogether.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 12, 2025 02:51 PM
Source:[gmx.at](https://www.gmx.at/magazine/wissen/weltraum/asteroid-2024-yra-wahrscheinlichkeit-einschlag-erde-erhoeht-40657904)

**World Bank Internship 2025: Apply Now for a Chance to Work with the Organization**
The World Bank has announced an internship program for 2025, offering a chance to work with the organization and gain valuable experience. The internship program will provide opportunities for candidates to work in various professional and technical fields, including economics and finance, human development, agriculture and environment, engineering and urban planning, natural resource management, and private sector development and corporate support. To be eligible, candidates must have a graduate degree or be enrolled in a regular graduate program. Proficiency in English is mandatory, and knowledge of French, Spanish, Russian, Arabic, Portuguese, and Chinese is also required. Strong computing and technical skills are also desirable. The World Bank will provide a stipend to interns, as well as a travel allowance of up to $3,000, but interns will be responsible for arranging their own accommodation. The selection process will involve notification of selected candidates by March 2025, followed by an interview and final selection in April 2025. The internship program will begin in May 2025 and run until August 2025.

Publish date: February 12, 2025 10:39 AM
Source:[News18 India](https://hindi.news18.com/news/career/education-internship-world-bank-2025-want-to-work-in-word-bank-then-apply-at-worldbank-org-how-you-will-be-selected-here-9027337.html)

**World Bank Internship Program 2025: Check out eligibility, stipend, application process & other details, apply by Feb 14**
The World Bank is offering an internship program for 2025, which provides an opportunity for students and recent graduates to work at the forefront of development and share fresh ideas. The internship is open to those studying economics, finance, human development, social sciences, agriculture, environment, engineering, urban planning, and corporate support. Eligible candidates must have an undergraduate degree or be enrolled in a full-time graduate study program and be fluent in English. The World Bank will pay an hourly salary and provide an allowance toward travel expenses up to USD 3,000. The application process is ongoing and will close on February 14, 2025. Candidates must upload their Curriculum Vitae, Statement of Interest, and Proof of Enrollment in a graduate program. Selections will be made in April 2025, and the new group of interns will start in early May 2025.

**Pakistan to 'host' another ICC event this year after Champions Trophy**
Pakistan will host the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 Qualifiers in April, featuring women's teams from six countries, including Pakistan, Bangladesh, Ireland, Scotland, Thailand, and the West Indies. The qualifying matches will be held in multiple cities across Pakistan, with the finalists securing their spots in the ICC Women's World Cup 2026. Pakistan's national women's cricket team is preparing for the challenge with a 27-day training camp at the High-Performance Academy in Faisalabad, which includes 50-over practice matches and rigorous training sessions. As compensation for not hosting India at the Champions Trophy, the ICC awarded the 2028 women's T20 World Cup to Pakistan, according to PCB officials.

**NASA: Stranded Astronauts May Return to Earth Sooner**
NASA announced that the stranded astronauts, Booch, Willmore, and Sonny Williams, may return to Earth sooner than expected. According to NASA, SpaceX will replace the capsule designated for upcoming space missions to bring the astronauts back to Earth in mid-March, instead of late March or April 2025. This change will shorten their prolonged stay on the International Space Station by at least two weeks, as they have been there for eight months. Steve Stich, NASA's Commercial Crew Program Manager, said, 'Human spaceflight is full of unexpected challenges.'

Publish date: February 12, 2025 05:37 AM
Source:[emaratalyoum.com](https://www.emaratalyoum.com/politics/news/2025-02-12-1.1920322)

**WORLD CLASS 2025: The Global Bartending Competition is Now Open**
The WORLD CLASS 2025 competition is now open for registration. The 16th edition of the global bartending competition will take place from January 14 to February 28, 2025. Interested bartenders can register online and create a unique cocktail with at least 30ml of Johnnie Walker Black Label. The top 20 contestants will be selected to compete in the German final on April 15-16, 2025. The winners will then participate in the nordeuropäischen Finale in Berlin and the global final in Toronto, Canada. The competition aims to bring together the best bartenders in the world and promote innovation, inspiration, and fine drinking. As WORLD CLASS Bartender of the Year, the winner will be a ambassador for fine drinking in their home country. 'It is the perfect mix of masterful skills, unrelenting passion, and striving for perfection that makes a WORLD CLASS Bartender,' says the competition. 'Creative cocktail creations, in-depth knowledge of premium spirits, exceptional techniques, and an unforgettable service experience - all this elevates a WORLD CLASS Bartender to a new level.'

**Countdown to Save the World from Climate Chaos**
Experts see a glimmer of hope, but demand viable measures to curb climate change. The year 2025 is crucial for the planet, and according to experts, what happens in the coming months will have a decisive impact on the future of our species and the world we live in. This is the year in which, as stipulated in the Paris Agreement, countries must present new plans to reduce emissions that will allow them to limit global temperature increases and contain climate chaos. The goal is to design 'more ambitious' and 'more viable' measures to curb the climate crisis. According to an analysis by the International Energy Agency, if current trends continue, the world will be exposed to an increase of 2-3 degrees Celsius in average temperature by the end of the century. In places like Spain, this would translate to an increase of over 4 degrees Celsius in average temperature, as well as more droughts, more torrential rains, and more extreme weather events. Carlo Buontempo, director of the Copernicus Service, says that the current situation is 'a warning signal' but not a definitive defeat in the fight against climate change. The study highlights 2025 as a key year for global climate action. According to the latest report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), this is the year in which greenhouse gas emissions must peak and then decline sharply to reach half by 2030 and net zero by 2050. However, current trends show that global emissions, especially those from fossil fuel combustion, continue to grow year after year. Experts emphasize that the effort must be common but not equal for all. 'Countries that have historically emitted more must make more efforts to reduce emissions,' says Olga Alcaraz Sendra, director of the group of researchers on climate change governance at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia. According to her analysis, based on equity criteria, countries like the US should be the first to apply drastic cuts and achieve climate neutrality. Europe should reduce its emissions by 90-95% by 2035. Achieving these numbers is not just a matter of mathematics, but international cooperation. 'No country has a concrete goal for reducing emissions, but rather each government sets its own objectives,' says Ana Pérez Catalá, researcher at the Institute for Sustainable Development (IDDRI) in Paris. According to her, the current context will be decisive for designing these climate objectives. On the one hand, the convulsive geopolitical situation, wars, and the victory of Donald Trump could minimize the importance of the climate debate. On the other hand, the increase in natural disasters on the planet, from the floods in Valencia to the fires in Los Angeles, could serve to design more ambitious measures. The great challenge of reducing emissions is in the hands of national policies and large-scale measures in economic and industrial sectors. However, experts emphasize that citizens also have a key role in this fight. But how? A survey led by the Ipsos platform showed the 'gap' between the measures people believe help reduce emissions and those that actually have an impact. The 59% of the population believes that recycling is a key measure to reduce emissions, but in reality, this measure has a minimal impact on emissions. In contrast, a measure like reducing car use, which only 17% of the population mentions, is the one that would save the most CO2. Similarly, among individual actions that are most effective in reducing emissions, minimizing flights, and adopting a more vegetarian diet with less meat stand out. The 2025 year starts with the ambitious challenge of accelerating the global climate fight. At least on paper, countries will have to present their updated plans for reducing emissions in the coming months. The EU will present its objective during the first quarter. After that, at the UN assembly in Brazil, it will be discussed whether the sum of all these commitments is enough to avoid extreme global warming. 'What gives me more hope is that we don't need magic recipes or science fiction tools. The solutions already exist and are already here,' concludes Pérez Catalá.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 09, 2025 12:12 PM
Source:[La Provincia](https://www.laprovincia.es/dominical/2025/02/09/cuenta-salvar-mundo-caos-climatico-114109160.html)

**March -- a Month of Destruction: Numerologist Reveals What Awaits Russia in 2025**
According to numerologist Mariana Anael, the world will face significant challenges in 2025. She stated that March will be one of the most difficult months, but by April, doors will open to restoration and harmony. Anael noted that the numbers indicate that in March, people can expect shocking news, destruction related to catastrophes or military actions. However, in April, the world may overcome this crisis, possibly bringing an end to the Ukrainian conflict. Whether politicians will seize this opportunity remains to be seen. 'Смогут ли политики использовать этот шанс, покажет время.'

**ITTF Announces 2025 World Cup Selection Criteria**
The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) has announced the selection criteria for the 2025 ITTF World Cup, which will be held in Macau, China from April 14 to 20. The selection process involves a series of continental cup tournaments, with the top four players from each tournament earning a spot in the World Cup. The tournaments include: the Oceania Cup in Melbourne, Australia on February 15-16, the Pan American Cup in San Francisco, USA on February 18-23, the Asian Cup in Shenzhen, China on February 19-23, the European 16 Cup in Montreux, Switzerland on February 20-23, and the African Cup in Tunis, Tunisia on February 25-27. The ITTF World Cup will feature a total of 20 players, with the remaining spots filled by the top 24 players in the world rankings. According to ITTF President, 'The selection process is designed to ensure that the World Cup features the best table tennis players from around the world.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 03, 2025 03:51 PM
Source:[中华网科技公司](https://news.china.com/socialgd/10000169/20250203/47926916.html)

**ITTF Announces 2025 World Cup Selection Criteria**
The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) has announced the selection criteria for the 2025 Men's and Women's World Cup. The tournament will take place in Macau, China from April 14 to 20. Athletes will compete for qualification through five continental cup events held this month. The top four players from each event will earn a spot in the World Cup, with a total of 20 players qualifying. Additionally, the ITTF has outlined the rules for qualifying for the singles World Cup: the latest World Champion will automatically qualify, as will the latest U19 World Champion. The remaining 24 players will qualify through world rankings, with the host association allowed to nominate up to two players if they do not qualify through the above criteria. The ITTF stated that, in principle, each association's number of participating players should not exceed four, but this limit can be increased to six for associations with players who have qualified through the first two criteria.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 02, 2025 06:40 PM
Source:[news.cn](http://www.news.cn/sports/20250202/4ca0df9f01ad4ae3941b986af545a611/c.html)

**ITTF Announces 2025 World Cup Selection Criteria**
The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) has announced the selection criteria for the 2025 Men's and Women's World Cup, which will be held in Macau, China from April 14 to 20. Athletes will compete for qualification through five continental cup events held in February. The top four players from each event will earn a spot in the World Cup. In addition to the continental cup events, the ITTF has also outlined the qualification rules for the singles World Cup: the latest World Champion and U19 World Champion will automatically qualify, as well as the top 20 players from the continental cup events and the top 24 players from the world rankings. The host association may also nominate up to two players if they do not have any qualified players through the above rules. ITTF stated that, in principle, each association's number of participating players should not exceed four, but associations with players qualified through the first and second rules may have up to six players.

**ITTF Announces Selection Criteria for 2025 World Cup, Ma Long, Fan Zhendong, and Chen Meng Ruled Out**
The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) has announced the selection criteria for the 2025 World Cup in Macau. The tournament, which will take place from April 14 to 20, 2025, will feature 48 teams. The top four teams from each of the five continents - Asia, Europe, Africa, America, and Oceania - will qualify for the World Cup through the continental championships. The remaining 28 spots will be determined by world rankings. Notably, Chinese table tennis players Ma Long, Fan Zhendong, and Chen Meng, who are all Olympic champions, have announced their withdrawal from the world rankings and will not participate in the Asian Cup in February. According to the ITTF's selection criteria, players who do not participate in the continental championships and do not meet the corresponding threshold in the world rankings will not qualify for the World Cup. This means that Ma Long, Fan Zhendong, and Chen Meng have already been ruled out of participating in the World Cup. 'It is a shame that they will not be able to participate in the World Cup,' said a spokesperson for the ITTF. 'However, we are confident that the remaining players will put on a great show and make the tournament a success.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 02, 2025 01:19 AM
Source:[南方网](https://news.southcn.com/node_179d29f1ce/7316904a9d.shtml)

**ITTF Announces 2025 World Cup Selection Criteria**
The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) has announced the selection criteria for the 2025 ITTF Men's and Women's World Cup, which will be held in Macau, China from April 14 to 20, 2025. According to the selection criteria, 48 teams will participate in the tournament, with 20 spots allocated to the top four teams from each of the five continents, and the remaining 28 spots determined by world rankings. ITTF President said, 'This selection criteria aims to promote fair competition and give opportunities to top players from around the world.'

**Global Seasonal Climate Update for February-March-April 2025 - World**
The global sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies remained above average from October to December 2024. The El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO) is expected to be neutral, with a slight chance of entering weak La Niña territory in the Niño 3.4 and Niño 3 regions. The Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) index is projected to return to near-average levels. Above-normal temperatures are predicted over most land areas for the February-April 2025 period, except for regions near the Bering Sea, the Gulf of Alaska, Baja California, and southwestern Greenland. Regions with a high probability of above-normal temperatures include South America south of the equator, the Caribbean and Central America, and Europe. In contrast, coastal areas of southern South America are expected to experience below or near-normal temperatures. The enhanced east-to-west SST gradient in the equatorial Pacific suggests rainfall patterns for FMA 2025 will reflect typical La Niña impacts, with regions such as the eastern Maritime Continent, southern parts of Central America and the Caribbean, and the Arctic regions north of 60°N experiencing enhanced probabilities for above-normal rainfall.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 21, 2025 12:41 AM
Source:[ReliefWeb](https://reliefweb.int/report/world/global-seasonal-climate-update-february-march-april-2025)

**Russia Invited to Participate in UEFA Tournament, Normalization of Relations Continues**
Despite the low chances of Russia's national football team participating in the 2026 World Cup, the team has been invited to participate in a tournament in Europe by UEFA. The organization has also agreed not to object to the use of the Russian flag and anthem. This is a positive development in the normalization of relations between Russia and international sports organizations. Russian athletes have been returning to international competitions, including the World Championships in swimming and the possibility of the national ice hockey team returning soon. However, the chances of the main Russian football team participating in official UEFA tournaments are still low, given that they were not even included in the draw for the qualifying tournament. Nevertheless, the youth team (U16) will participate in a UEFA development tournament in Minsk in April 2025, where they will face teams from Belarus, Kazakhstan, and China. This is a good opportunity for young Russian footballers to gain international experience without having to compromise on their flag and anthem. As one UEFA official noted, 'it is not necessary to give up the flag and anthem to participate in these tournaments.'

Publish date: January 07, 2025 11:19 AM
Source:[sportbox.ru](https://news.sportbox.ru/Vidy_sporta/Futbol/spbnews_NI2154201_Sbornuju_Rossii_priglasili_na_turnir_v_Jevropu_UJeFA_dazhe_ne_protiv_flaga_i_gimna)

**Big Names in Literature: 2025's Most Anticipated Books**
The new year brings a plethora of highly anticipated books from renowned female authors. Chimamanda Adichie returns with 'The Inventory of Dreams' (Einaudi), a novel that explores themes of feminism and racism. Maylis de Kerangal's 'Day of the Backwash' (Feltrinelli) is a 24-hour police investigation that becomes an introspective journey. Jojo Moyes' 'We All Live Here' (Mondadori) is a comedic novel filled with empathy and humor. Jamaica Kincaid's 'The Walk on the Himalayas' (Adelphi) makes its Italian debut. Petra Delicado's six investigations are collected in 'A Little Bit of Good' (Sellerio) by Alicia Gimenéz-Bartlett. Yasmina Reza's highly anticipated novel 'Normal Life' (Adelphi) is set to be released in April. Cormac McCarthy's drama 'The Stonecutter' (Einaudi) is a previously unpublished work in Italy, written in the late 1980s and first published in 1994. Colm Tóibín's 'Long Island' (Einaudi) is a sequel to 'Brooklyn', while Martin Suter's 'Melody' (Sellerio) is an international success. Samantha Harvey's 'Orbital' (NN) is a masterpiece that won the Booker Prize 2024, a poignant meditation on space and life on Earth.
Original language: it
Publish date: January 05, 2025 05:20 AM
Source:[quotidiano.net](https://www.quotidiano.net/magazine/libri/adichie-de-kerangal-reza-un-91809e89)

**2025 Will Be the Year of Global Disasters**
The World Weather Attribution (WWA) organization, which brings together scientists from around the world, has released its report on the 2024 year. The report states that 2024 was the hottest year on record, with 41 more days of extreme heat than the previous year. The organization warns that this trend may continue in 2025 and has announced 'urgent' action plans. Here are some striking details from the report: The report highlights that extreme weather conditions reached dangerous levels in 2024, causing record-breaking temperatures, heatwaves that killed thousands of people and displaced millions, droughts, forest fires, and floods. The report emphasizes that these extreme weather conditions show how dangerous life has become due to human-induced 1.3 degree warming. The report states that 26 extreme weather events were analyzed in 2024, resulting in 3,700 reported deaths. However, it is emphasized that the report only includes events that meet certain criteria, and that tens of thousands of people may have died from extreme weather events that are not recorded. The report highlights that heatwaves are the most deadly type of extreme weather event, but that the dangers of high temperatures are not being adequately communicated. The report emphasizes the importance of early warning systems, citing the example of a hospital in Mali where temperatures reached almost 50 degrees Celsius in April, leading to an increase in deaths. The report states that early warning systems are crucial for reducing deaths, and that they should be targeted, provided days in advance, and include clear instructions for what people should do. The report emphasizes that most extreme weather events can be predicted, and that every country should implement, test, and continuously improve early warning systems to ensure that their citizens are safe. The report also emphasizes the need for urgent action on fossil fuels, citing the recent COP28 agreement to phase out fossil fuels. The report states that a rapid transition to renewable energy will help create a safer, healthier, more prosperous, and more stable world. The report emphasizes that developed countries should provide developing countries with tools to invest in adaptation, which will help protect their lives and livelihoods and create a more stable and equitable world.
Original language: tr
Publish date: January 04, 2025 06:11 AM
Source:[haberglobal.com.tr](https://haberglobal.com.tr/yazarlar/artik-vakit-kalmadi-2025-kuresel-afetler-yili-olacak-408724)

**Global Events to Watch in 2025**
The world awaits significant events in 2025, including the global year of quantum science and technology, partnerships, and glacier preservation, as declared by the UN. Some key events include: Poland will chair the European Union from January 1 to July 1, 2025. The 82nd Golden Globe Awards will take place on January 5. The CES-2025 consumer electronics show will be held in Las Vegas from January 7-11. Donald Trump will be inaugurated on January 20. The 55th World Economic Forum will be held in Davos from January 20-24. Presidential elections will be held in Belarus on January 26. The Chinese New Year will be celebrated on January 29. Frida Kahlo and Henri Matisse's works can be used for free. UK tourists will need to obtain an ETA electronic travel authorization from January, while EU citizens will need it from April 2025. The Super Bowl LIX will take place on February 9 in New Orleans. Presidential and parliamentary elections will be held in Ecuador. The first space rescue operation will take place. Astronauts Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore will return to Earth after eight months on the ISS. The Formula 1 season will start on March 13 in Australia and end on December 7 in Abu Dhabi. The Expo 2025 exhibition will be held in Osaka, Japan, from April 13 to October 13. The EU-Startup Summit will take place on Malta from April 24-25. Ryanair will stop using paper tickets and boarding passes, making all processes digital. The Venice Architecture Festival will start on May 10 and end on November 23. The Eurovision Song Contest will be held in Basel, Switzerland. The FIFA Club World Cup will start on June 14 in the US. The NATO Summit will be held in The Hague from June 24-26. The G7 Summit will be held in Canada. The Women's Euro 2025 football championship will start on July 2 in Switzerland. The Tour de France will start on July 5 in Lille. The 80th anniversary of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki will be commemorated on August 6. The 2025 World Games will be held in Chengdu, China. The 80th UN General Assembly will start on September 9 in New York. The World Athletics Championships will be held in Tokyo from September 13-21. The IMF and World Bank annual meeting will be held in Washington from October 17-19. The Nobel Week will take place, with awards in physiology or medicine, physics, chemistry, literature, and peace. The Grand Theft Auto VI game will be released. Microsoft will stop supporting Windows 10, Office 2016, and other products. The G20 Summit will be held in Johannesburg, South Africa, from November 23-25. The UN Climate Conference will be held in Brazil.

**A Guide to the Night Sky and Other Celestial Wonders for 2025**
The year 2025 will bring a pair of lunar eclipses, but no solar eclipses like the one that captivated North America last spring. The world will have to wait until 2026 for the next total solar eclipse. However, the cosmos promises many other amazing moments in 2025. The year will start with a parade of six planets in January that will be visible for weeks. Little Mercury will join the crowd for a parade of seven planets in February. 'People should get out to see them at some point over the next few weeks. I certainly will,' said Bruce Betts, the chief scientist of the Planetary Society. There will be three supermoons in October, November, and December, with the moon appearing particularly large and bright while orbiting closer to Earth than usual. A double cosmic event will repeat in September with a total lunar eclipse lasting over an hour over Europe, Asia, Africa, and Australia, and a partial solar eclipse two weeks later near the southernmost point of the world. Six of our seven neighboring planets will align in the sky to form a long arc in mid-January, with all, except Neptune and Uranus, visible to the naked eye just after sunset, if the weather permits. The parade will continue for weeks, with some planets occasionally approaching. Mercury will make a brief appearance at the end of February. The planets will gradually exit, one by one, during the spring. The sun shone brightly last year, painting the sky with beautiful auroras in unexpected places. Space meteorologists predict more geomagnetic storms that could produce even more auroras borealis and australis. This is due to the Sun reaching its maximum solar activity during its current 11-year cycle, which could continue this year. Shawn Dahl, of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, encourages everyone to stay informed about space weather, so as not to miss any spectacular shows. The Perseids and Geminids are phenomena that always attract a crowd and reach their peak in August and December, respectively. However, don't rule out smaller and less spectacular meteor showers, such as the Lyrads in April, the Orionids in October, and the Leonids in November. The darker the location and the more opaque the moon, the better the observation will be. Meteor showers are generally named after the constellation in which they appear to originate. They occur when the Earth passes through streams of debris left by comets and, occasionally, asteroids.

**Forecast: A look ahead to what 2025 has in store**
In 2025, several significant events are expected to take place. Donald Trump will become the oldest person to be sworn into the US presidency on January 20, despite being a convicted felon. Germany will hold a snap federal election on February 23, with polls suggesting that Chancellor Olaf Scholz may struggle to remain in power. The UK will mark the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II, with £10 million allocated for events to commemorate Victory in Europe (VE) Day and Victory in Japan (VJ) Day. The Special Olympics World Winter Games will take place in Turin, Italy, from March 8 to 15, featuring 1,500 athletes from 102 nations. NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore will return to Earth in a SpaceX capsule in late March. Japan will host the World Expo from April 13 to October 13, with the theme 'Designing Future Society for Our Lives.' Gabon will hold its first elections since the end of the Bongo family dynasty in August 2025. The Women's Rugby World Cup will be held in England from August 22 to September 27, featuring 16 teams from seven regions. Brazil will host COP30 from November 10 to 21 in Belem do Para, a city located at the edge of the Amazon forest. Events will be held around the world to commemorate Jane Austen's 250th birthday on December 16.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 01, 2025 06:59 AM
Source:[france24.com](https://www.france24.com/en/culture/20250101-forecast-a-look-ahead-to-what-2025-has-in-store)

**Punit Nahata's Predictions for 2025: A New World Order and a Bright Future for Russia**
Indian prophet Punit Nahata, known as the 'Indian Nostradamus', has made predictions about 2025. According to him, the year will be better than 2024, but the first five months will be marked by serious conflicts, especially in March. However, in April and May, things will return to normal. Nahata advises people to take care of themselves, their loved ones, and not to escalate the already tense situation in the world. He believes that if people focus on their health, work well, and help those in need, they will avoid problems. Nahata predicts that 2025 will bring a new world order, with technology dominating the world. He also believes that the world will become more integrated, with many countries becoming one nation by the 2040s. The prophet also made specific predictions about Russia, saying that it will enter a period of stability after April 2025, with a focus on technology, economy, and global development. Nahata emphasized that Russia will remain Russia and will have a bright future for the next 60 years, with improvements in agriculture, foreign relations, trade, economy, and education.
